definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: It summarizes the famous doctors experience, and promotes traditional Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 总结名医经验，弘扬祖国医学。

sentences.english: If they were to come tonight, they could meet the famous doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们今晚来的话就能见到那名医了。

sentences.english: He went to Paris to study with a famous French doctor, Charcot.
sentences.chinese: 后来他去了巴黎，师从法国名医夏科特。

sentences.english: The Mayers have been distinguished doctors for generations. It runs in the blood.
sentences.chinese: 迈耶一家世代名医，从医是他们的祖传。

sentences.english: Xiong Linbo was named one of the ten eminent doctors in Yueyang City in 2008
sentences.chinese: 熊林波2008年被评为岳阳市首界十大名医。

sentences.english: Skilled medical advice shall is at once seek.
To train the famous doctors is a systemic program, which needs the combination of the practice and theory.
sentences.chinese: 造就名医是个系统工程，理论和实践统一才有功底。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang is a famous doctor.
This well-known doctor will operate on the baby's eyes .
sentences.chinese: 这位名医将给那个婴儿做眼部手术。

sentences.english: I believe Lucy will become a famous doctor.
sentences.chinese: 我相信露西会成为名医。

sentences.english: Oh, sorry. I forget the famous doctor's name.
sentences.chinese: 噢，很抱歉，我忘记了那位名医的姓名。

definition: to practice medicine (esp. in private practice)
Sun Simiao (c. 581-682), doctor and herbalist of the Sui and Tang dynasty, author of Prescriptions Worth a Thousand in Gold 千金要方[Qian1 jin1 Yao4 fang1]
practice medicine or pharmacy to help the people or public
to employ/to send for sb promising employment
Hua Tuo (?-208), famous doctor at the end of Han Dynasty
